What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment

Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: 30 minutes - 1 hour to read papers from the speaker
I enjoyed how this course exposed us to different types of research related to infectious disease.

Good-- would be nice to have more speakers who intersect more with other departments. Many of the seminars were very bio/research heavy and specific for certain diseases, would be nice to have a balance--for instance someone who works in vaccination policy, practicing epidemiologists, or people who have jobs we could get right after this master's rather than just academic research every single week.

Overall I enjoyed the diversity of the speakers and the depth of their presentations. However, after the classroom was switched from LEPH to 47 College Street I could never find the sign-in QR code. A physical sign-in would have been better.
I enjoyed this course. Sometimes the presentations were at levels above my understanding, but that is my only comment. Thank you
good, learn about the frontier of EMD research.

This was hands down my favorite course of the semester. The strength was that despite my lack of biology/science knowledge, I was still able to participate in the discussions of class. She encouraged discussion and critical thinking throughout the course and created a safe environment where it was more about encouraging deeper thoughts about the subject rather than right or wrong answers. I understood the reasoning for the exam formats, but it did give me a lot more pressure trying to boil down loads of content to 4 questions; I would mistakenly try to know every single detail about every thing we ever covered, and sometimes be hurt by not being able to answer some questions in depth. But she did grade generously to make up for that. I wish the course wasn't right after lunch.
Enjoyed listening to various professionals talk about their work. There could be better food options that accommodate different dietary restrictions

I really enjoyed the seminar! I loved being able to hear about the work being done at Yale by our own professors and faculty, but also visiting professors. It was really cool to see this wide range of people doing a wide range of research from many different angles. I enjoyed this every week. Plus, a free lunch is great too.
Always great to hear lectures of leaders across fields associated with EMD.
Good seminar that was informative on research and problems regarding infectious diseases. Wish the timing was alittle better instead of weekly maybe having it bi weekly
Why do I, a first-year grad student, have the power to to evaluate Gregg Gonsalves, a MacArthur fellow? I am removing my voice from this conversation.
My instructor was Melinda Pettigrew (it's listed incorrectly above).
Great host and moderator. Always timely.

This course allowed students to explore different types of research in infectious disease and meet new faculty members both from Yale and other institutions. I would recommend it to students because it exposed me to different research interests.
Good introduction to topics of interest to EMD faculty and students. Broad scope of topics. I would recommend this course to another student.
good. Then you will have an explicit idea about which research realm you want to dive in.
Amazing course and so glad I am in EMD for making me take it.
Just show up, eat, and listen to cool people talk about their cool work.
Good seminar class to learn about certain infectious diseases.
